title: Tassels, early 18th century
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Pair of elaborate tassels in needlework, attached to narrow silk bands with cut velvet pattern. From main tassels of colored silk and metal threads hang many small figures, animals and birds. One figure in bright red, modern and made in Guatemala.

tombstone.epitaph:
Tassels, early 18th century.
early 18th century. Medium: silk, metal
Technique: embroidered. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-58-9.
